metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3656 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 3.6.24and 4.x through 7 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script orHTML via vectors involving HTTP 0.9 errors, non-default ports, andcontent-sniffing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 11.0+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-globalmenu - 11.0+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-mozsymbols - 11.0+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-testsuite - 11.0+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0+build1-0ubuntu4').
